OOC: Sorry, Sandy posted while I was drafting this post. I added it
in, but=
 it is not as smooth as I would have liked it to be. Ahh well
such is life.=
 Good posting Sandy by the way! :)

IC:

> <OLD>
>
> Tucson turns to Legacy=
 on a dime. He did not like his tone of voice, and
> felt that his explanat=
ion could have been a little less brash. Especially
> when you're addressin=
g a Prime officer. His expression hardens quickly.
>
> " I appreciate your =
concerns but I do NOT appreciate your tone of voice!
> It's as if you're tr=
ying to stop me from doing what needs to be done! This
> war can not be fou=
ght by ourselves, they out number us! And I will do
> everything in my powe=
r to be sure that our numbers stay stable!"
>

> <OLD>
>
> She nodds.
>
> "=
Yes, sometimes the unthinkable must be the thinkable. It was his way of
> s=
aying that in desperate times, desperate measures can not be avoided. Even
=
> if the balance of time does get disrupted."
>
> He nodds.
>
> " Exactly. =
We need help, and maybe it isn't time to wake up Optimus Prime,
> but we mu=
st try and revive others to assist us in battle. Legacy, I warn
> you now, =
insubordination will not be tolerated. Am I understood?"
>

<NEW>

Legacy s=
tood his ground, his stance not aggressive but simply solid
and ready as he=
 watched Tuscon. If Legacy had any fear of Tuscon or
the power that he poss=
essed or the anger that may be unleashed there
was not a hint of it on Lega=
cy=92s face or demeanor. Neither was there
any hint of it in his next state=
ment. =93Your rank and objectives are
duly noted and are at this juncture i=
rrelevant.=94

Legacy=92s words are completely devoid of anger, aggression =
and tact.
They are instead just simple statements of fact as he sees them.
=

=93Legacy what are you doing?=94 A voice rippled across the room =96 LORD
=
ELDER! =93You can=92t stand against a Prime!=94

=93I am a temporal guardia=
n sent back to insure that all things unfold
as they should and I will stan=
d against any force that would attempt
to disrupt that.=94 Legacy folded hi=
s arms behind his back, which had
the affect of focusing his weapons away f=
rom Tuscon. There was still
no hint of aggression in his tone or stance, an=
d for a bot as
powerfully built as Legacy that was a difficult task. Legacy=
 was tall
and sturdily built and he was, except for his color, was an exact=

=91physical=92 replica of Shockblast; He bore a cannon on one hand and the=

other hand that WAS a cannon and he possessed a remorseless
unflinching cy=
clopean gaze with which he was currently directing at
Tuscon.

Elder, who l=
ooked startlingly bigger and more robust stepped into the
room, walking to =
stand between Legacy and Tuscon. =93I am not talking
about COMBAT.=94 He sa=
id looking at the tall form of Legacy, =93I am
talking about respect, chain=
 of command, duty, honor, the things we
Maximals stand for.=94

Legacy look=
ed down at Lord Elder, his single optic pulsing
thoughtfully, =93Your emoti=
onal adherence to respect is inefficient, I
could not allow any disturbance=
 to the Autobots and Decepticons that
lay here.=94

Lord Elder patted Legac=
y on the shoulder, having to reach up slightly
to do so. =93I know Legacy, =
I know, but it is what makes us different
from the predacons.=94

Legacy pa=
used obviously not agreeing.

> <OLD>
>
> Perceptor looked at tucson and sa=
id coldy "that's a strategy that we cannot
> afford, but"he added with anot=
her tone"We can ask to pacificus Maximals to
> join us... and fuse both fac=
tions, that will give us enough streght to face
> hydras and whoever dares =
to challenge us... By now we must to find a way to
> protect the ark"
>

<N=
EW>

Lord Elder nodded as he turned to Perceptor and the others, =93Yes! We=

can attempt to bring in others help us.=94 Lord Elder glanced between
Tusc=
on and Legacy hoping that Tuscon would catch the hint, you can=92t
brow bea=
t Legacy, you have to reason with him.

> <OLD>
>
> Tucson acknlowedges Per=
ceptor but still holds a rather cold expression on his face, which was most=
ly meant for Legacy.
>
> "Very well Perceptor, I will hold off until we are=
 able to contact the Pacificus Maximals. If we can not reach them, then we =
might have to resort to other measures."

<NEW>

Legacy appears unaffected =
by Tuscon=92s cold glance, however the shield
that was over Optimus Prime d=
ropped. Lord Elder just shook his head as
he stepped out from between them =
breathing an audiable sigh of relief,
hopefully the disaster has been avert=
ed for the moment.

> <OLD>
>
> Without further word, Tucson quietly walks =
over to the body of Optimus Prime, and just stands beside him. It would app=
ear that Straight Shot was right. He had learned so much, but missed the op=
portunity to learn the wisdom he feared he was missing. He kneels in front =
of the sleeping Autobot Commander.
>
> " Once again I almost made a costly =
mistake. I learned so much from my comrades and I'm grateful for the knowle=
dge they've given me, but still, Optimus, I wish I could have learned your =
wisdom. I could really use it now. So much happening at once and I don't kn=
ow where to begin doing something about it. I should know these things by n=
ow, that's why I was given the power of leadership. I can't let them down, =
not this time. My comrades have seen enough grief, they don't need any more=
 of it. Now I wish we did have time to work together, one on one. That way =
I would be prepared for what comes next."

<NEW>

Legacy said nothing as Tu=
scon turned away and began talking with
Optimus Prime. After noting Tuscon=
=92s actions Legacy also turned and
walked away, seemingly harboring no ill=
 will for Tuscon, his only goal
the protection of the Ark and most notably =
the current time stream.

[MEANWHILE IN THE MEDBAY]

Rodimus sat over his w=
ife as she seemed to waken . . .

> Nightligh tried to make a big sfort to =
sit down but her energy
> levels, on purpose, were to low for that, she sto=
pped too weak to
> move and said "Rodimus... Are you you?... Is that nightm=
are finaly
> over????"

Rodimus leaned close to her so that she could clear=
ly hear his words
and see his face. =93Yes my love, the darkness has past, =
the nightmare
has ended.=94

Rodimus smiled warmly and encouragingly as he =
gently turned up her
power levels a little and helped her sit up. =93You ar=
e safe at the
Ark.=94

(TAG)

Preston
